title: Accenture | Advanced Application Engineer Analyst  vs  Startup | Fullstack role
content:
Education: Computer Science Engineering from a Tier 2 college (2024 graduate)
Prior Experience: 6 months of internship experience

(oncampus offer)
Company: Accenture 
Title/Level: Advanced Application Engineer Analyst (Full-time role)
Location: Bangalore
CTC: 11 LPA
Base: 9 LPA
Other Details: Will be given a project related to JAVA full stack or Generative AI, depending on requirements.
Pros: More secure job, relatively lesser workload, will have time to prepare and crack better opportunities.
Cons: Service-based company, so may get fewer opportunities in the future.


(off campus offer)
Company: Product-based startup (started in 2018, small startup consisting of around 200 employees)
Title/Level: SDE (Full stack role) (3 months intern + full-time)
Location: Bangalore
CTC: 35k stipend (during internship), 10 LPA (during full-time)
Base: 10 LPA
Other Details: Need to work on React (frontend) and Spring Boot (backend). Can get more ownership (even DevOps) depending on my performance there.
Pros: Learning will be high.
Cons: Less secure, workload is high (might not get time to maintain my current coding level in terms of DSA and to apply to other companies).

Final Goal: To be in a big product-based company as a software engineer where importance is given to work-life balance and pay is high.
Please advise: Which option is more likely to help me achieve this goal, considering job security also matters in the current down IT market, especially for freshers like me?

title: Tide | SDE 4 | Bangalore
content:
Education: BTech CSE
Years of Experience: 8
Prior Experience: US based startup
Current comp : 30.8 (28 + 10% variable)
Date of the Offer: Aug 2024
Company: Tide
Title/Level: SDE 4
Location: Banaglore
Salary: 44,00,000
Relocation/Signing Bonus: NA
Stock bonus: 2500 number of Tide stock options (4-year vesting plan with 1-year cliff)
Bonus: NA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 44 (not considering stock as it is paper money)
Benefits: 
1. Reimbursement of upto 50% for setting up workspace (capped at 9000 INR). 
2. 40K INR training support budget.

Interview experience : https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-experience/5714277/Tide-or-SDE-4-or-Bangalore-or-Aug-2024-Offer
salaryTotal: : 44 (not Considering Stock As It Is Paper Money)

title: Nielsen | Software Engineer
content:

Years of Experience: 2 year+
Current Compensation - 4.5

Company: NIELSEN
Title/Level: Software Engineer
Location: Mumbai
Salary: 10L Fixed + 75K performance
Relocation/Signing Bonus: NA
Stock bonus: NA
Bonus: NA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 10.75 LPA
Benefits: Term, Health and Accidental Insurance

title: Arista Networks Compensation| Software Engineer | 4yrs exp | Blr
content:
Education: B.E, CSE, Tier - 3
Years of Experience: 4 years and 2 months, SDE 2, Non FAANG Product company.
Date of the Offer: Aug, 2024
Company: Arista Networks
Title/Level: Software Engineer (SAND team)
Location: Bangalore

Base pay: INR 28,00,000
Retirals: INR 2,35,340 (PF + Gratuity)
Anniversary Bonus: INR 3,00,000 (no clawback)
Joining Bonus: Nil
Relocation Bonus: Nil
Stock bonus: $30,000 (25% vesting for 4 years)
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): ~ INR 39.5LPA first year
Benefits: standard benefits like insurance, sodexo allowance of INR 5,000/m etc

Prev TC: 30LPA (23L base)

I tried negotiating  for base > 30L, they said its not possible, what should I do ?
yoe: 4 Years And 2 Months, Sde 2, Non Faang Product Company.
